title: TheBeardedBaby
author: TheBeardedBaby
content: I just got a pm that one of my post was deleted, but there is no link to the thread and even not the subject of the thread. Like I have to remember where I posted it like 3-4 years ago maybe even older.Here's the how the message looks like:Quote from: Bitcoin ForumA reply of yours, quoted below, was deleted by the starter of a self-moderated topic. There are no rules of self-moderation, so this deletion cannot be appealed. Do not continue posting in this topic if the topic-starter has requested that you leave.You can create a new topic if you are unsatisfied with this one. If the topic-starter is scamming, post about it in Scam Accusations.Quote<edited out due to not relevant to the topic>Could be nice if we get some sort of info when we get such massages.

Like I have to remember where I posted it like 3-4 years ago maybe even older.Could be nice if we get some sort of info when we get such massages. If the post is some years old there is just 1 option that you have to look for and thats at http://ninjastic.space/ and you will find the topic.But yes you are right it would be helpfull if we get a link to the topic where the post was deleted and not only the deleted message in a quote.I was a few times also in that situation that i have to remember where the post was made.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: While I agree that info like title of the topic and the user name of topic starter could be useful, we also both know that if you search the quoted text on https://ninjastic.space/search you'll find the missing piece(s) of the puzzle (meanwhile this was already said).For example, I think that the post you are talking about starts with "Back in the day" and ends with "feeling" and was deleted in 25 October As background info, in case you've missed it, Ratimov has removed quite a bunch of his self-mod topics and all the posts from them.(You may want to read https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5471601.0 and some related drama.)

comments.author: TheBeardedBaby
comments.body: Thanks guys,¬† I know the workarounds but for me it should be logical to get the info in the pm, that what made me surprised, and I can't find a logical reason why it should not be there.Anyway, thanks for the heads up, I'm a bit out of time to spend here the past year or so. It could be a great idea to have like a newsletter one a month of the most intriguing things going on in here Hoping for a better time ahead and to come back again as in the good old days Cheers, I miss you guys really üç∫üòä
